newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Amplats sees better trading in year ahead.
newsitem.headline: Amplats sees better trading in year ahead.

text.p: South Africa's Anglo American Platinum Corp (Amplats) said on Tuesday that it expected to see a better trading performance for the year ended June 30, 1998.

"The restructured Amplats group's trading performance for the year ending June 30, 1998, is expected to be better than that of the combined trading performance of the constituent companies in 1997," the firm said in a statement with its annual results.
The company warned, however, the volatility of the South African rand could alter its profit outlook.
Amplats plans to merge its three mines and the group into one listed company, using Rustenburg Platinum Holdings as the unified vehicle with effect from September 1.
Amplats said it expected higher average platinum prices than in the 1996/97 year resulting from continued lower supply levels.

The company said there were signs that Russian platinum sales will be lower in 1997 than they were in 1996. Amplats earlier announced a fall in 1996/7 earnings per share from 190.3 cents to 162.8 cents and held its dividend at 120 cents.
The company said its earnings per share on a restructured basis would have been 282.3 cents against 295.2 cents.
